name: English curry
description: The curry blend of spices as we know it was invented by British traders that brought spices from India to the British Isles. This quite mild mix adapted to the European palate coupled with the use of flour took away the Indian soul of the dish, but produced an interesting result nevertheless.
instructions: - In a large pan with some oil fry fry the chicken until slightly brown on all sides.
- Remove it and add the sliced carrots with the diced onions along with a bit more oil. Once the onions are cooked, add the finely chopped apples and bell peppers.
- After 3 minutes, add the wine and wait for it to evaporate. Once so, open a spot in the middle and add the flour with the minced garlic, waiting a minute.
- Put in the mashed tomatoes, wait until they reduce slightly.
- Cover with water and put in the curry, bay leaf and thyme. You can also add the apple peels. Leave for 30 min.
- Add a splash of milk, check for consistency.
- Remove the bay leaf, apple peels and turn off heat.
